author: Isaac Asimov
title: Foundation
reason: Classic sci-fi with mind-blowing ideas about the future of humanity.
notes: Loved the politics and psychohistory concept.

author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
reason: Fun and magical, a perfect escape.
notes: Reread as an adult; still enjoyable.

author: George Orwell
reason: Dystopian novel that makes you question society.
notes: Pay attention to the newspeak concepts.

author: Frank Herbert
title: Dune
reason: Epic sci-fi saga with political intrigue and desert planets.
notes: Complex but rewarding, especially the world-building.

author: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
reason: A timeless story about justice and morality.
notes: Loved the character development of Scout.

author: Neil Gaiman
title: American Gods
reason: Weird and wonderful story about mythology in modern America.
notes: Beautifully written, sometimes confusing but worth it.

author: Brandon Sanderson
title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
reason: Unique magic system and engaging heist story.
notes: Loved the twists and character arcs.
